channel.title: Time to upgrade hardware
channel.description:
A few months ago I purchased a new GPU and PSU, along with a case to harbor new hardware, and I've finally decided to upgrade my stock CPU and motherboard. I'm having a problem finding a good pair, since I have to make sure the following conditions are met:
[ul][li]The motherboard fits in my case. (My case will fit any motherboard up to the size ATX and WILL NOT fit E-ATX)[/li] [li]The motherboard socket matches the CPU socket[/li][/ul] I don't necessarily think the first problem will be an issue, since there aren't too many motherboard that won't fit my case. Anyways, the original combo that I was planning on getting were these two: Motherboard: [url=http://www.amazon.com/ASRock-Z87-CrossFireX-Motherboard-EXTREME4/dp/B00CZXYH8G/ref=sr_1_2?ie=UTF8&qid=1392361299&sr=8-2&keywords=asrock+lga1150]http://www.amazon.com/ASRock-Z87-CrossFireX-Motherboard-EXTREME4/dp/B00CZXYH8G/ref=sr_1_2?ie=UTF8&qid=1392361299&sr=8-2&keywords=asrock+lga1150[/url] CPU: [url=http://www.amazon.com/Intel-i7-4770K-Quad-Core-Processor-BX80646I74770K/dp/B00CO8TBQ0/ref=sr_1_1?s=electronics&ie=UTF8&qid=1392361157&sr=1-1&keywords=intel+i7+4770k]http://www.amazon.com/Intel-i7-4770K-Quad-Core-Processor-BX80646I74770K/dp/B00CO8TBQ0/ref=sr_1_1?s=electronics&ie=UTF8&qid=1392361157&sr=1-1&keywords=intel+i7+4770k[/url]
The one thing I noticed right off is that the CPU socket wasn't labelled as LGA1150, which would be a big issue with the motherboard above, so I scrolled down to view the hardware, and where it says 'Compare to Similar Processors' it says Socket H3 (1150). Is this the same thing as LGA1150, and if not, would my motherboard still support it?
Also, the reason I would like to go with this motherboard is due to the results of the benchmarks [u][url=http://www.cpubenchmark.net/high_end_cpus.html]here[url][/u]. Unless I'm mistaken and am not able to read a chart, it seems that it provided the best performance : price ratio for its score. If you have any suggestions for a better setup (keeping the price somewhat close to the current one), then I would be grateful, but it seems like if these sockets fit, the output should be great. Another reason is the possibility for overclocking this processor later, although I'm not that big of a fanatic when it comes to tweaking hardware as much as possible.

item.title: Time to upgrade hardware
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:3, topic:540076”][quote author=xx matty xx link=topic=658926.msg4407218#msg4407218 date=1392370485]
They’re both LGA1150 (both pages say this).
[/quote]^

I would also use pcpartpicker website to assist with compatibility/current sells on websites such as newegg[/quote]
Thank you so much for the site recommendation. I was able to find the same motherboard for like $20 cheaper, and it will also ship faster than the previous seller.

xx matty xx:

They’re both LGA1150 (both pages say this). Is that what you’re asking?

Yes, this was the biggest question I had about the processor, so thanks!

Read full topic

item.title: Time to upgrade hardware
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

A few months ago I purchased a new GPU and PSU, along with a case to harbor new hardware, and I’ve finally decided to upgrade my stock CPU and motherboard. I’m having a problem finding a good pair, since I have to make sure the following conditions are met:

[ul][li]The motherboard fits in my case. (My case will fit any motherboard up to the size ATX and WILL NOT fit E-ATX)[/li]
[li]The motherboard socket matches the CPU socket[/li][/ul]
I don’t necessarily think the first problem will be an issue, since there aren’t too many motherboard that won’t fit my case. Anyways, the original combo that I was planning on getting were these two:
Motherboard: http://www.amazon.com/ASRock-Z87-CrossFireX-Motherboard-EXTREME4/dp/B00CZXYH8G/ref=sr_1_2?ie=UTF8&qid=1392361299&sr=8-2&keywords=asrock+lga1150
CPU: http://www.amazon.com/Intel-i7-4770K-Quad-Core-Processor-BX80646I74770K/dp/B00CO8TBQ0/ref=sr_1_1?s=electronics&ie=UTF8&qid=1392361157&sr=1-1&keywords=intel+i7+4770k

The one thing I noticed right off is that the CPU socket wasn’t labelled as LGA1150, which would be a big issue with the motherboard above, so I scrolled down to view the hardware, and where it says ‘Compare to Similar Processors’ it says Socket H3 (1150). Is this the same thing as LGA1150, and if not, would my motherboard still support it?

Also, the reason I would like to go with this motherboard is due to the results of the benchmarks [url=http://www.cpubenchmark.net/high_end_cpus.html]here[url]. Unless I’m mistaken and am not able to read a chart, it seems that it provided the best performance : price ratio for its score. If you have any suggestions for a better setup (keeping the price somewhat close to the current one), then I would be grateful, but it seems like if these sockets fit, the output should be great. Another reason is the possibility for overclocking this processor later, although I’m not that big of a fanatic when it comes to tweaking hardware as much as possible.

Read full topic
